position.marginalia_text: Bellum adhuc Macedonicum. Sed tandem cum Philippo pax: cum Antiocho bellu[m].

marginalia.translation: Still the Macedonian war. But peace with Philip at last; war with Antiochus.

position.marginalia_text: politica obseruatio ipsius Liuij. vnum bellum vna tempestate gerendum: pluribus simul bellis distringi, valdè solicitum, magisq[ue] periculosum. Quod tamen aliquotiès audebant pra[e]potentes Romani, nusq[uam] perterriti. Est autem casus singularis, et vnum experimentorum extraordinarioru[m]. Quasi magnifica Exceptio, non contra, sed pra[e]ter regulam politicam: quales non[n]ullae suo loco.

marginalia.translation: A political observation of Livy himself. One war should be fought per single occasion; it is very troubling and dangerous even more to be burdened by several wars at the same time. Which, however, the superior Romans dared several times, not frightened as they were of anything. Yet this is a unique case, and one of exceptional experiments. A brilliant exception, as it were, not against the political rule but beyond it: a bit more of this at its proper place.
